intro: Muellerargia jeffreyana, commonly known as the Jeffreys muellerargia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
